name: Melia White House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is situated a few yards from a tube station, you can also walk to regents park & London Zoo.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good service

likes.liked: — The Royal Service Lounge and the lifts
likes.disliked: — The bar area is slightly under lit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It is definately worth up grading to a Royal Service room as the guest lounge is excellent, free breakfast, snacks and drinks.
reviews.title: Great deal for three girlfriends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel together with my sister-in-law and a friend of ours. We were very happy with the hotel. Since there were three of us we booked a junior suite and this was really a great deal. Altogether we paid £160 for three nights which included a very big breakfast buffet and free drinks and tapas in the lounge in the evening. As you know, London is very expensive and by eating and drinking in the lounge we could put all that money in our shopping accounts instead!
reviews.title: Experiences from other point of view
Great hotel, fantastic breakfast!
reviews.text: The hotel itself was fine, the room quite big and the bathroom very clean. We all liked the area and that it was so close to the Regent's Park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only thing we can complain about was that the Underground station Great Portland Street was closed during the weekend and it was a real hassle getting from and to the hotel because of this. ;-)
reviews.title: Hotel was OK if you paid reduced cost!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of our Honeymoon theatre break, my wife and I stayed at the Melia White House and cannot praise it highly enough,
reviews.title: Delightful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Melia is part of a Spanish leisure group, so natch the majority of staff were Spanish. The Reception was immaculate and clean.
reviews.title: excellent service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fantastic, Air conditioning and a huge King Size bed, ideal for a chunky chap like myself. The standard of housekeeping in the bedroom was very high.
reviews.title: why does anyone stay here???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel as it was close to Warren St and Great Portland St underground stations so travel to the west end was very easy.
reviews.title: An oasis

likes.liked: — A little bit of 4 star comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only gripe was the price of the Breakfasts at nearly £20 a head it was a bit excessive.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing hotel

likes.disliked: — Price of any hotel services is very expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room which had a 6ft bed, double glazing and was slightly bigger and nicer decorated than the standard rooms. The room was very stuffy and the aircon didnt appear to work so we had to have the windows open all the time which did tend to get a bit cold at times, but not long after you closed them the room was too stuffy again.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay, would stay here again

likes.liked: — Hotel cleanliness and location to where I wanted to be

reviews.title: Watch the VAT!!!
reviews.text: The bathroom was not very well lit, no light over the shower or toilet the only light was above the sink.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the hotel I thought was disappointing, we ate in both of the restaurants and didnt really enjoy the food and thought it was expensive for what it was.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

likes.liked: — The free evening bar and our lovely waitress
likes.disliked: — Doesn't have it's own parking, but there is plenty of street parking around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very clean, staff were courteous and friendly, most of them were Spanish or other foreign nationality and the only time there was a language problem was with one of the waitresses in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Very Surprised!

likes.liked: — Friendly Staff, Overall a positive experience.
likes.disliked: — Shower was a bit dangerous to step in and out of.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again, location is good and overall cost of hotel room is very competitive against other hotels of the same standard.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: booked with last minute.com secret hotels. Shared twin with my daughter, very small , uncomfortable single beds with old-fashioned sheets and blankets. Very dated decor, only one chair in the room, very basic. Tiny Bathroom, only one hand towel. paid £99 incl breakfast. Normal price is £240 plus £25 for room upgrade. Certainly not worth it. Large Buffett breakfast with lots of choice, but slow service. Would not book this again or recommed to anyone, stayed in the Marriot before, 10 times better.
reviews.title: certainly not 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pluspoint: Good public transport nearby, lots of bus stops, and three tube stations. Fairly quite area.
reviews.title: OK - but beware of the different junior suite room size!

likes.disliked: — Front Desk, Terrible Customer Service, Junior Suites are not all the same size (quite a big difference in size in fact)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back from London at the end of August and stayed at the Melia White House Hotel for 5 nights.
reviews.title: Very professionnal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the hotel around 2:30pm and we got checked in right away. Got to our room and was quite surprised at how tiny the room is for a supposed "Junior Suite" that we paid for. It didn't look like a junior suite but I took that as it's simply because rooms in Europe are typically smaller. But anyhow, it looked a lot smaller from the pictures and virtual tours shown for junior suite rooms. Our room had a king size bed and a sofa bed. The room was too cramped for 3 skinny people and our luggage. You can bounce from one wall to the other.
reviews.title: Two classes of rooms

likes.liked: — Hard to say - it was close to Regent's Park and the tube, but that's about all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't take the upgrade simply because we were already supposed to be in a Junior Suite and our deal already included breakfast so whatever deal came with the upgrade was worth paying for more.
reviews.title: Good Value for London at $140

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Melia White House for four nights and thought it was all presentation. The positives were that it was somewhat conveniently located, every cab driver knew where it was, it was very close to a tube station, and the breakfast was very good. The main negative was that for an expensive hotel, the service was not very good. The staff was nice but completely unhelpful and unintelligent. For example, we were meeting up with my sister-in-law who had arrived at the hotel the day before and were expecting to meet her when we got to the hotel. She had left a handwritten note for us at the front desk, and the front desk failed to give us that message when we checked in. Instead they gave us the message hours after we checked in, explaining that they could not give us the note earlier because they did not have a room number to match the note to. I.e., they could not figure out how to leave a note for us to give us when we checked in. Thus, we sat in the hotel lobby for an hour just waiting for my sister-in-law, not knowing that she'd be late because the hotel front desk didn't give us any messages when we asked if there were any. That's just one example of their complete unhelpfulness. In addition, we reserved a king sized bed and instead got two twin beds pushed together. We were told that there were no more rooms with an actual king sized bed, even though we checked in early. All in all, I would say that the fact that this hotel was convenient to get to was the ONLY reason worth staying there.
reviews.title: Overpriced for the value

likes.liked: — Every cab driver knew it; the breakfast was very good.
likes.disliked: — The staff was unhelpful and unintelligent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can simply say I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. I would recommend it for special occasions and for romantic weekends in London.
reviews.title: Highly recommended with the right offer

likes.disliked: — the room was a bit small

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Melia Whitehouse for our anniversary on 19/20th August and can't fault the hotel, we had noted on our booking that it was a special occasion and can honestly say the hotel made it even better for us, we were allowed to check in early, we were upgraded to a superior room and all the staff from the check in staff to the cleaning staff were courteous and pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities and location were excellent, the selection at breakfast great, they were very busy on our first day for breakfast but rather than allow anyone to wait they redirected us to the Royal Lounge to prevent queuing.
reviews.title: Enjoyed a weekend at the Melia
Superb Hotel
reviews.text: In all we can't wait to return and I hope to take my Mum for her birthday later in the year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm so sorry to give this hotel 2 stars; it really deserves more, but this is an example of how 2 negative experiences can ruin a rating.
reviews.title: Great hotel with problems---what a shame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For one thing, we got an exceptional deal through Priceline at $200 a night. For central London in September and this type of hotel, this is a great, great bargain. The hotel is centrally located with the Great Portland Street tube right across the street and the Regents Park tube down the block. We walked from the hotel to Oxford Street in about 20 minutes. It's not Soho, Covent Garden, but it's still a great location.
reviews.title: Great hotel, comfy room and amazing breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is busy, clean and impressive. The staff at the front desk is all Spanish and were in general, courteous. Our room, which consisted of two double beds, two bed tables, mini-bar, a large tv and two desk was very small and cluttered. The hotel should consider eliminating one of the desks to give a little more space. However, small rooms are typical in London so we really weren't expecting anything big and were satisfied. Beside, the bathroom, in turn, was large and everything, in usual Melia style, was well decorated and impeccably clean. Melia might also consider flat-panel tvs as the set was bulky and took up lots of space.
reviews.title: A very ncie hotel in the heart of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast the following morning at £20 per person. $40 might seem a lot to US travellers, but for what was served and considering we were in London, I found the price acceptable. It is quite an impressive buffet with lots of meats, pastries, hot items, fruits and an omelette station. For London, it's a good deal to really fill up here and then have a heavy dinner later on.
reviews.title: Be Very Selective!

likes.disliked: — Small room over-priced food/drinks (even by London standards)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, about those two experiences which made me drop my rating: When we arrived at our room, the room was extremely hot (and it was hot outside as well). We turned on the a/c and waited a bit for the room to cool off but the temperature stayed the same and we noticed that no air was blowing from the air ducts. We called the front desk and were transferred to maintenance. The maintenance person told us she would send a technician to the room immediately. After waiting 15 minutes in a steaming room with the hallway door open to let in a breeze, we called the front desk again and rather than receiving an apology, were transferred again to maintenance. This time, we were told that the technician could not be located but as soon as one appeared, they would send him/her to the room. I found this excuse unacceptable as given a hotel this size and of this quality, I can't imagine how a technician can't be located (at least tell me he/she is busy). After waiting another 10 minutes, I went to the front desk to complain and was told that there was nothing to be done but wait for the technician. This really upset me. I am a MaS Card member (Melia's reward program) and have over 60,000 points in my bank. I didn't expect special treatment because of this, but given my loyalty to the chain, they could have easily switched my room or at least been more attentive. We had engagements in London and after an hour, decided to leave; fortunately, the a/c was fixed when we returned later that night.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We decided to have a weekend break to pamper ourselves from work stress and tension. We decided to choose this hotel based on its very good price value. We book directly from hotel's website a superior deluxe room with a £140 per room per nite including breakfast
reviews.title: Splendid!!
Nice, but with a few catches
reviews.text: The room is marvelous! It has a huge bed - a king bed with a very stylish and classy deco. Very comfortable. Tv cabinet with refrigrator and mini bar, coffee & tea facility. Large in size and all marble bedroom. Iron and ironing board, safe box. Internet access, a coffee table and 2 chair for tea. Beautiful bathroom with decent size, bath with great shower, all over tiles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: The breakfast is the best breakfast we've ever seen in any hotels in Europe! It has everyhting....from pancakes to waffles to all kind of muffins, danish and bread, cook from order omelletes and full english breakfast with all kind of sausages!!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!
A nice hotel if you can get a good rate.
reviews.text: The lobby is very stylish, all marble and very posh in decoration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: It just 4 stop tube from victoria station if you stop in warren street tube station via victoria line and walk just 10 mins to the hotel. The hotel is just opposite the great portland street tube station
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good stay close to Regent's Park.
reviews.title: Good stay in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2002, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spanish staff are more friendly than most london hotel staff.
reviews.title: Top Service

likes.liked: — The location and the peace and quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Gym is larger than it appears, with around 20 excercise machines (albeit no weight machines) and free weights ranging from 2 - 10 kgs (around 4 to 22 lbs).
reviews.title: Overall very good

likes.disliked: — Lifts - You select the floor you want before you are told which left to enter - quite confusing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: small, but this is typical of any London hotel. Comfortable (medium) bed with down pillows. In-room electronic safe provided. Internet access is a pay as you go service, it is far cheaper to use a cybercafe on Oxford Street. Minibar is also provided (though do not plan on using it as a personal fridge, an electronic sensor detects this and charges 15 pounds a day). My only major complaint is that there are only 2 electical outlets with easy access.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

likes.liked: — It was very clean and very quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom equipped with hairdryer. Bathtubs are deeper than average (a plus) though it is fairly difficult to get in and out without slipping. Lotion, shampoo and bath gel (generic Melia brand) are provided. Also available (for 4 pounds and up) is a menu of bath salts from the dead sea.
reviews.title: Relaxing, warm and friendly

description: The Melia White House hotel was built in 1936 and was originally launched as The White House luxury apartments. The hotel’s building still preserves its architectural value as a prime example of art décor style in late 1930s. After a recent refurbishment, guests can now have a more pleasant and unique experience when sating in London. This 4-star deluxe hotel includes 581 rooms, 112 apartments, 9 meeting rooms, 2 restaurants and a bar including a terrace, fitness centre and an executive lounge. The hotel’s unique location, award winning food offering and true passion for service will make of your stay in London a pleasant and unique experience.
